image.altText: An older man wearing a red tie, white shirt and a black suit jacket with a serious expression

props.synopsis: It follows an executive order that allowed the US State Department to cancel travel for refugees already cleared to resettle in the US. Follow live.

title.children: Thousands of refugees stranded worldwide as Trump administration cancels resettlement

image.altText: Donald Trump pictured in the Roosevelt room in the White House

props.synopsis: Donald Trump threatens Russia with "high levels" of tariffs if Vladimir Putin fails to make a deal that ends the "ridiculous war" in Ukraine.

title.children: Trump threatens Putin with 'high' tariffs if he fails to end 'ridiculous' Ukraine war

image.altText: Prince Harry in a navy blue suit with a silver tie.

props.synopsis: The lawsuit was settled amid News Group Newspapers offering a "full apology".

title.children: Prince Harry settles lawsuit against British tabloids

image.altText: A woman sitting on a pile of rubble, looking on.

props.synopsis: Leila and Ibrahim el Arja fled their home in Rafah, southern Gaza, in May last year. This week they returned, amid a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, but what they found only added to their devastation.

title.children: 'Every house reduced to rubble': Gazan family's painful return to Rafah

image.altText: Reece Kershaw speaking at the National Press CLub

props.synopsis: AFP Commissioner Reece Kershaw has clarified a statement he released on Tuesday evening.

title.children: AFP suspects organised crime groups behind some anti-Semitic attacks

image.altText: Carolyn Heise

props.synopsis: Ahead of the next federal election, a sophisticated grassroots campaign is again looking to shake up the two-party system and break the major parties' decades-long stranglehold on blue-ribbon seats. This time, some community independents will have the added assistance of a brand new fundraising vehicle.

title.children: Independents Day 2.0: Country campaign set to disrupt two-party machine

image.altText: A projection on buildings shows an outline of Donald Trump's hair being blown by a wind turbine, with the words FUTURE VS TRUMP

props.synopsis: President Donald Trump has wasted no time dismantling climate policies and promising a new era of fossil-fuel dominance, withdrawing the US from the Paris Agreement on his first day back in office.

title.children: Trump wants to 'drill, baby, drill', but how much climate damage can he do?

image.altText: Alex de Minaur looks confused on court at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur is knocked out of the Australian Open by defending champion Jannik Sinner, who wins their quarterfinal 6-3, 6-2, 6-1 inside two hours.

title.children: 'I don't want to leave like this': De Minaur's exit sours best Aus Open

image.altText: A white man wearing a suit and tie, highlighted against a dark crowded background

props.synopsis: Politicians aren’t afraid of complaining privately about the public thinking they’re not productive, now they've got a chance to change that.

title.children: Women poured their hearts out on poor health care — so where is the government?

image.altText: A picturesque landscape of a town built around a large hill filled with greenery.

props.synopsis: As demand for healthcare outstrips supply, some country towns have been offering huge incentives to attract doctors but other shires have raised concerns about being unable to retain or attract GPs because they can't afford it.

title.children: The 'bidding war' for Australia's GPs isn't fair and it's set to escalate

image.altText: A blonde man flips open a folder at a desk

props.synopsis: Along with a flurry of executive actions, Donald Trump's first full day in office featured a pointed sermon, a "nice" letter from former president Joe Biden and the release of January 6 prisoners. These were the key takeaways.

title.children: On his first day back, Trump faces a 'nasty' sermon and a slew of lawsuits

image.altText: Shop building on street with police tape

props.synopsis: Detectives are continuing to investigate "suspicious" fires in Sydney's east in October believed to be linked to the recent spate of alleged anti-Semitic arson attacks in the city.

title.children: Man charged by police investigating anti-Semitic attacks pleads guilty to Bondi fire

image.altText: Three black plastic kitchen utensils including a spatula and a spoon

props.synopsis: Chemosphere – a peer-reviewed scientific journal – was forced to issue a correction after scientists made a major error calculating the toxicity of black plastic kitchen utensils.

title.children: Why there's more to the viral plastic kitchen utensil story than first thought

image.altText: A cartoon cat.

props.synopsis: Before Mickey Mouse, Felix the Cat was the biggest thing in animation. But behind the success of the cartoon cat, his creator lived a controversial and tragic life.

title.children: The tragic and sordid history of the world's first cartoon superstar

image.altText: Two men with black hair smile widely while holding each others arms and hands while looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Thailand is the first country in South-East Asia to legalise same-sex marriage.

title.children: Thai same-sex couples prepare to marry on historic day

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Anti-Semitic graffiti mentioning Hitler and showing a swastika along a brick wall.

props.synopsis: The firebomb attack on a childcare centre was the eighth anti-Semitic attack in Sydney in just three months. Is enough being done to stop the crimes and are our political leaders making things better or worse?

title.children: ABC News Daily: How politicians are failing on anti-Semitism

image.altText: Screenshot of Iga Swiatek reaching for a ball.

props.synopsis: Iga Świątek dealt a straight-sets blow to Emma Navarro to reach the semifinals at the Australian Open, setting up a clash with Madison Keys.

title.children: Double-bounce drama mars Świątek's swift advance to semis

image.altText: A bald man sits alone at a long table with a microphone. He is wearing a black suit, white collared shirt and purple tie.

props.synopsis: Carlton Football Club president Luke Sayers says a lewd photo was posted to his social media after it was compromised, and he will step down immediately.

title.children: Carlton president steps down, as AFL inquiry finds he did not breach rules

image.altText: A firefighter in the middle of a firestorm

props.synopsis: As Los Angeles enters its third week of fires, officials made preparations to protect scorched neighbourhoods from toxic ash runoff ahead of potential rain this weekend.

title.children: California enters third week of fires with fears rain could cause toxic runoff

image.altText: Lidia Thorpe

props.synopsis: The hearing in Western Sydney saw governments again accused of endangering communities by failing to act on warnings about PFAS chemicals.

title.children: Furious residents accuse government of 'reckless misconduct' at PFAS inquiry

image.altText: A man in a black singlet is questioned by uniformed police

props.synopsis: An integrity expert has called for an investigation after footage of a prominent Darwin silk inside a police watch house was leaked to the media following his arrest on a drink-driving charge.

title.children: Call for police leak probe in Darwin barrister's drink-driving case

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: When a press release is being released on a meeting's outcomes 67 minutes after the meeting started, it's easy to get the picture that the "meaningful legal reform" being called for from people like anti-Semitism envoy Jillian Segal wouldn't be happening — at least not now.

title.children: One image was all it took for Albanese's defences to come crumbling down

image.altText: Sexual abuse victim

props.synopsis: A child sex abuse survivor has urged other victims to come forward after her abuser — a former South Australian police officer and her then-stepfather — was jailed for four years.

title.children: Child abuse survivor speaks out after ex-cop stepfather jailed

image.altText: A close up of a man lifting the bar weights at the gym.

props.synopsis: In online groups and gyms, users self-experiment and swap information about performance and image-enhancing drugs. While this "broscience" can be dangerous, it can also be used for good, say scientists.

title.children: Researchers study 'broscience' to limit its harm

image.altText: The exterior of a building with NDIS signage prominently displayed on the outside. Location is not specific.

props.synopsis: A record fine has been handed down to an NDIS service provider after a man choked and died in its care.

title.children: NDIS provider given record fine after man died choking on sandwich

image.altText: A close-up of Michael Fanone, who is beared and has a tattoo on his neck.

props.synopsis: Michael Fanone, who was beaten and repeatedly tasered at the US Capitol, says he's asked a court for protection after Donald Trump pardoned the rioters.

title.children: Police officer bashed on January 6 fears freed rioters will come after him

image.altText: Donald Trump gestures with both hands at a podium in the White House

props.synopsis: Democratic-lead states and civil rights groups have filed a slew of lawsuits in response to Donald Trump's bid to roll back a principle that has been recognised in the US for more than 150 years.

title.children: Democratic-led states sue over Trump's birthright citizenship order

image.altText: An assumed ai generated image of cranes on a bluesky as an oil painting

props.synopsis: The US president says Stargate will build the physical and virtual infrastructure to power the next generation of advancements in AI.

title.children: The key players behind Stargate, Trump's $500 billion AI project

image.altText: A multi story building charred from a fire.

props.synopsis: Guests were forced to jump out the window of the 11-storey building to escape the fire.

title.children: 76 killed in Turkish ski resort fire that was 'like an apocalypse'

image.altText: The outside of an engineering workshop with signage above the door.

props.synopsis: Trade assistant Haydyn Grubb, 26, died after a heavy metal frame fell on him at a Kalgoorlie workshop in 2020, less than three months after he started the job.

title.children: Magistrate fines engineering firm $685k over young worker's death

image.altText: Sammy edited hat

props.synopsis: The family of five-year-old Sammy who died after a parking meter fell on him at a museum in Bunbury say he "brought so much joy".

title.children: Family says boy crushed by parking meter 'brought so much joy'

image.altText: A hook the size of a mans palm.

props.synopsis: Wildlife officers were searching a Townsville river for a site to set their own traps for a "problem crocodile" when they discovered a homemade hook and snare line.

title.children: Rangers investigate homemade trap designed to 'hook and kill' crocodile

image.altText: A mobile phone photo shows a very crowded cell in a Thai detention centre

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump's incoming secretary of state is among those calling for Thailand not to deport a group Uyghurs to China, where it is feared they would face persecution.

title.children: Trump appointee backs calls for Thailand to halt Uyghur deportations

image.altText: A black and white etching showing eight men in different forms of 18th century naval uniform standing on a ship's deck

props.synopsis: The discovery that scurvy, a debilitating illness caused by vitamin C deficiency, could be treated with citrus fruit transformed 19th century naval exploration around the world.

title.children: Two million sailors died of scurvy until the discovery of a simple cure
